edu.caltech.sbw
Class SBWRPC

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.caltech.sbw.SBWRPC
public abstract class SBWRPC
extends Object

Message formats

There are four message types:
  • reply message (code 0)
  • send message (code 1)
  • call message (code 2)
  • error message (code 3)
Call and send messages have the following form: 
 ,--------v------v------v-----v-----v------------v-----------v------.
 | length | dest | type | mID | src | service id | method id | data |
 `--------^------^------^-----^-----^------------^-----------^------'
where the meanings of the fields are as follows:
length
(4 bytes) the length of the message, including the length field
dest
(4 bytes) an identifier indicating the destination module for the message
type
(1 byte) the message type code (call, send, reply, error)
mID
(4 bytes) a unique identifier/sequence number for this message
src
(4 bytes) the identifier of the source module originating this message
service id
(4 bytes) an identifier indicating the desired service
method id
(4 bytes) an identifier indicating the desired method on the service
data
(arbitrary) the arguments to the method

Reply messages have the following format: 

 ,--------v------v------v-----v------.
 | length | dest | type | mID | data |
 `--------^------^------^-----^------'
where the meanings of the fields are as follows:
length
(4 bytes) the length of the message, including the length field
dest
(4 bytes) an identifier indicating the destination module for the message
type
(1 byte) the message type code (call, send, reply, error)
mID
(4 bytes) a unique identifier/sequence number for this message
data
(arbitrary) the arguments to the method

Error messages have the following format: 

 ,--------v------v------v-----v-------v----------v--------------.
 | length | dest | type | mID | error | user msg | detailed msg |
 `--------^------^------^-----^-------^----------^--------------'
where the meanings of the fields are as follows:
length
(4 bytes) the length of the message, including the length field
dest
(4 bytes) an identifier indicating the destination module for the message
type
(1 byte) the message type code (call, send, reply, error)
mID
(4 bytes) a unique identifier/sequence number for this message
error
(1 byte) a code indicating the type of exception
user msg
(arbitrary) a string giving a user-readable message of the error
detailed msg
(arbitrary) a string giving a more detailed error message

Version:
$Revision: 1.2 $
Author:
Andrew Finney, Michael Hucka, $Author: mhucka $

call

public DataBlockReader call(int moduleTo,
                            int service,
                            int method,
                            DataBlockWriter args)
                     throws SBWException
Handles "call" operations: invokes the given method of the given service on the given module, and blocks until the method has completed and returned a value. The return value is in the form of a DataBlockReader messaging primitive.

Parameters:
moduleTo - the id of the module to which to send the message
service - the id of the service to invoke
method - the id of the method to invoke
args - the DataBlockWriter containing the payload of the message
Returns:
DataBlockReader the message body returned from the call
Throws:
SBWException - if any problems occurred during the call
See Also:
send(int moduleTo, int service, int method, DataBlockWriter args)

receive

public void receive(DataBlockReader reader)
Receive a message and do something appropriate with it. By the time this method gets invoked, the length and destination parts of the message block have been consumed, and what is left is the rest of the message beginning with the type field. This method basically just looks at the message type and then farms out the work to one of the other, more specific methods.

Parameters:
reader - the DataBlockReader containing the message.

transmit

public void transmit(int moduleTo,
                     edu.caltech.sbw.DynamicByteArray messageForRelease)
              throws SBWCommunicationException,
                     IOException
This will throw a IOException if the underlying communications system (i.e., the TCP/IP socket stream) reports an error. The calling method should use this to trigger actions required upon losing the connection to the SBW Broker.

cleanupPendingCalls

protected void cleanupPendingCalls()
